CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 17, 1968, pg. 5 reads: "Spark Mission Emphasis - "Punching Holes in Darkness" was the theme for the "Memphis Emphis" weekend at Macedonia Baptist Church, Bedford Ave., Pittsburgh, recently. Pictures above are the specialists who contributed to the three-day mission study series.  They are, left to right, the Rev. Alfred M. Pugh, pastor of the host church; Rev. Elmer Williams of Vaux Hall, N.J., guest speaker; Mathias A. Ogutu of Kenya, Africa; Mrs. Usha Iyengar of India; Mrs. Corrine Moses, local and state missionary leader and Peter Mukasa Magoye of Uganda East Africa.  Little Beverley Robinson, seated in the foreground, seems to be completely awed with the "warm-up" session. - (Harris Photo).
TitMainTitle: Rev. Alfred M. Pugh, Rev. Elmer Williams, Mathias A. Ogutu, Usha Iyengar, Corrine Moses, Peter Mukasa Magoye, and Beverley Robinson in foreground, gathering in Macedonia Baptist Church for mission study program
